business.headline: India overtakes Japan to become fourth-largest economy: Niti AayogIndia has overtaken Japan to become the world's 4th largest economy, with a GDP of $4 trillion. NITI Aayog projects India will become the 3rd largest economy in the next 2-3 years, surpassing Germany. Factors contributing to this growth include infrastructure development, Make in India initiative, GST implementation, and fiscal discipline during the COVID-19 pandemic. The country has reduced extreme poverty to less than 5% and is poised for rapid growth.

India now fourth-largest economy, ahead of Japan: Niti Aayog CEOIndia's GDP has reached $4 trillion, placing it behind only the US, China, and Germany, according to IMF data cited by NITI Aayog CEO BVR Subrahmanyam.

Trump targets Samsung after tax threat to Apple for India shift: Wouldn't be fairThe US President warned that Samsung, and not only Apple, would face a 25% import tax if its phones were not manufactured in America.
Trump proposes 50% tariff on EU goods from June 1Trump criticised the EU for maintaining restrictive trade practices, levying high taxes, and taking legal action against US companies.

RBI to pay Rs 2.69 lakh crore to government as dividend for FY25The RBI has approved a large dividend of Rs 2.69 lakh crore for the financial year 2025, which is higher than Rs 2.1 lakh crore given last year.

Not India or anyplace else: Trump's 25% tariff warning if iPhones not made in USDonald Trump's statement on levying 25% tariff on iPhones has caused Apple shares to fall by 2.5% in premarket trading, and US stock futures also slipped. However, it's still unclear whether Trump actually has the legal power to impose a tariff on one specific company.

Fresh IPOs likely to flood Dalal Street: Time to ride the wave?Four IPOs are lined up to open in the last week of May. These include Scoda Tubes, Prostarm Info Systems, Leela Hotels (Schloss Bangalore Limited), and Aegis Vopak Terminals.

Rs 10 crore for child's education? Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta's maths and messageRadhika Gupta explained that the current cost of a full higher education in the US is around Rs 2.5 crore. Now, if you consider average inflation of 5% and currency depreciation of 4% every year, the value of that education will go up a lot over the next 16 years.

Sensex, Nifty close higher over US-China trade hopes despite FII outflow fearsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 769.09 points to close at 81,721.08, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 243.45 points to end at 24,853.15.

Microsoft, Google and more cut over 61,000 jobs in 2025: Here's why?One of the biggest cuts came from Microsoft, which let go of 6,000 employees, its largest round of job losses since 2023. Nearly 2,000 of these were in Washington state alone.

Reliance Power Ltd share price rises over 18%. Should you buy?Reliance Power has gained 20.77% in the last month, 51.98% over the last six months, and 99.13% over the past year. Over the last five years, it has gone up by a massive 2,820.56%.

entertainment.headline: Metro In Dino 1st look: Anurag Basu's film introduces modern love, relationships'Metro In Dino' first look was unveiled by the makers on social media. The film introduces the entire star cast, including Anupam Kher, Sara Ali Khan, Aditya Roy Kapur and Pankaj Tripathi, among others.

Paresh Rawal reacts to Akshay's lawsuit: My lawyer has sent an appropriate responseParesh Rawal has responded to Akshay Kumar's legal notice over his sudden exit from 'Hera Pheri 3', stating that his lawyer has sent a proper reply. The actor has also returned the signing amount with interest, but the legal dispute may delay the film's progress.

Anushka Sharma, Virat Kohli visit Ayodhya's Ram Mandir and Hanuman GarhiAnushka Sharma and Virat Kohli offered prayers at Ayodhya's Ram Mandir and Hanuman Garhi after RCB vs SRH match in Lucknow on May 23. Pictures and videos of the couple's visit have gone viral.

Cannes candids: Jane Fonda is all admiration for Alia Bhatt's Gucci-saree lookAlia Bhatt represented her culture at Cannes in a Gucci saree. The actor was joined by Hollywood icon Jane Fonda, who admired the Bollywood actor's ensemble.

Khushi TDT-Lashcurry on success of Victory Anthem, politics in music industryVictory Anthem by Khushi TDT and Lashcurry is a powerful hip-hop track that has struck a chord with millions globally, inspiring listeners to overcome life's challenges. The hip-hop artists, in an exclusive interview, opens up about the process of making the song and its widespread success.

Ikkis: Dharmendra, Agastya Nanda's war-drama to release on Gandhi JayantiDharmendra and Agastya Nanda's upcoming war drama 'Ikkis' is set to release on October 2, 2025. The makers announced the news with a teaser.

Actor Shiva Rajkumar dedicates song to Kamal Haasan, recalls best meeting with himActor Shiva Rajkumar was the chief guest for the 'Thug Life' audio launch in Chennai held on Saturday, May 24. He recalled his memorable meeting with him in Bengaluru.

Actor Simbu breaks down thanking parents, addresses controversies at Thug Life eventActor Silambarasan aka Simbu was moved to tears while thanking his parents at 'Thug Life' audio launch. He addressed many controversies and thanked Kamal Haasan for being a guiding light for every cinema aspirant.

HIT 3 OTT release: When and where to watch Nani's crime thrillerNani's 'HIT: The Third Case' will be streaming in Netflix from May 29, 2025. This earlier-than-expected release has surprised many, as previous reports had suggested a June 5 premiere.

Triptii Dimri to join Prabhas in Sandeep Reddy Vanga's Spirit amid Deepika's exitTriptii Dimri has officially joined Prabhas in Sandeep Reddy Vanga's upcoming film 'Spirit'. This comes amid Deepika Padukone's exit from the project.

Siddhant-Triptii's Dhadak 2 gets U/A certificate after 16 major edits'Dhadak 2', starring Siddhant Chaturvedi and Triptii Dimri, has received a U/A certificate from the CBFC after making 16 major edits to address political, caste, and religious sensitivities. The film is now ready for release after overcoming several certification hurdles.

Crunchyroll Anime Awards 2025: Nominees to live streaming, all you need to knowThe Crunchyroll Anime Awards 2025 returns with a spectacular global live stream featuring top anime series and international stars. Check out everything you need to know.

Sikandar OTT release: When and where to watch Salman-Rashmika's action dramaSalman Khan's action drama 'Sikandar' is set to stream on Netflix from May 25 after a modest box office run. The streaming giant announced the news on social media.

Paresh Rawal returns Hera Pheri 3 signing amount with interest: ReportVeteran actor Paresh Rawal has exited 'Hera Pheri 3' due to disagreements over a payment clause in his contract. He returned the Rs 11 lakh signing amount with 15 per cent interest to the producers.
Great Indian Kapil Show returns with Season 3 and a unique twistKapil Sharma's 'The Great Indian Kapil Show' is set to return with Season 3. The new season will premiere on Netflix on June 21.

Kapkapiii X reviews: Fans call Shreyas-Tusshar's film perfect weekend watchShreyas Talpade and Tusshar Kapoor return with the horror-comedy 'Kapkapiii'. Fans are calling it a fun, must-watch film that brings back the magic of classic Bollywood comedies.

Actor Paritosh Tripathi, wife Meenakshi become parents to baby girlActor Paritosh Tripathi and his wife Meenakshi Chand welcomed their first child, a baby girl, on May 23. Tripathi shared the news with a post on social media.

Vir Das mocks Cannes dress code with fake 'nude, long train' outfitComedian Vir Das hilariously trolled Cannes 2025's strict red carpet dress code by posting a photo-shopped image of himself in an exaggerated nude gown with a long train.

Bollywood expands spectrum as neurodivergent actors become Sitaare Zameen ParBollywood is gradually embracing neurodivergent individuals to share their stories, moving beyond stereotypical portrayals seen before. Films like 'Sitaare Zameen Par' highlight autism and Down syndrome with more authenticity, though challenges remain in true representation.

general news.headline: Over 200 flights hit, roads waterlogged as heavy rain lashes Delhi-NCROver 200 flights were affected, and several areas reported waterlogging after Delhi-NCR was hit by heavy rain and a storm.

India now fourth-largest economy, ahead of Japan: Niti Aayog CEOIndia's GDP has reached $4 trillion, placing it behind only the US, China, and Germany, according to IMF data cited by NITI Aayog CEO BVR Subrahmanyam.

Iconic, that's the word. Alia Bhatt in Gucci's first-ever saree-inspired outfitAlia's final look on the Cannes carpet was an amalgamation of heritage and haute couture. Styled by Rhea Kapoor, the look is allegedly Gucci's first-ever interpretation of the Indian saree.

I don't work for government: Shashi Tharoor's reply to Pahalgam question in USCongress MP Shashi Tharoor is leading a parliamentary delegation under Operation Sindoor outreach. At the Indian Consulate in New York, he praised India's strikes on Pakistan-backed terror camps.

How the power of translation helps many a Heart Lamp shineBanu Mushtaq's anthology in Kannada was unknown to Indians, let alone readers across the world. It was translator Deepa Bhasthi who shone the light on it as Heart Lamp. Both Mushtaq and Bhasthi have been awarded the International Booker Prize. Indian writing's global success is being penned in the language of translation, opening new chapters and challenges.

Kush Maini becomes 1st Indian to win F2 Monaco GP, Anand Mahindra reactsKush Maini became the first Indian to win the Formula 2 Sprint Race at the Monaco Grand Prix. After he won, business tycoon Anand Mahindra praised him for the stupendous achievement.

Videos: Cars, buses submerged, trees uprooted as rain pounds Delhi-NCRHeavy rain, gusty winds and thunderstorms battered Delhi-NCR early Sunday, leading to severe waterlogging in several areas including Moti Bagh, Minto Road, and near Airport Terminal 1.

Bypolls of 5 assembly seats in Gujarat, Kerala, Punjab and Bengal on June 19The seats across all five states include Kadi and Visavadar in Gujarat; Nilambur in Kerala; Ludhiana West in Punjab; and Kaliganj in West Bengal.

Anushka Sharma, Virat Kohli visit Ayodhya's Ram Mandir and Hanuman GarhiAnushka Sharma and Virat Kohli offered prayers at Ayodhya's Ram Mandir and Hanuman Garhi after RCB vs SRH match in Lucknow on May 23. Pictures and videos of the couple's visit have gone viral.

'Militant leader' Yunus selling off Bangladesh to US: Sheikh Hasina's big chargeSheikh Hasina alleged that Yunus is running the government with the help of militants and slammed him for imposing a ban on her party, the Awami League.

BJP MP's 'women should've fought' remark on Pahalgam attack sparks rowJangra made controversial remarks about the widows of the Pahalgam terror attack, suggesting they should have fought back against the terrorists instead of pleading for their husbands' lives.

Coast Guard on high alert after vessel with hazardous cargo sinks off KochiAll 24 crew members aboard the Liberian-flagged ship were safely rescued, with 21 picked up by ICG ships and 3 by the Indian Navy's INS Sujata.
Karan Johar's diet? Needles out. Foods in.On Karan Johar's birthday today, we look back at how the producer embraced the OMAD diet for a healthier lifestyle.

Shubman Gill, India's first accidental Test captain of the 21st century Shubman Gill's appointment as captain reflects a leadership vacuum in Indian cricket, driven more by circumstance than readiness. His inconsistent form and unproven credentials raise concerns about the team's direction during this transitional phase.

Central funds, water share: Non-BJP states' demands at PM-led NITI Aayog meetAs Prime Minister Narendra Modi pitched for Centre-state unity in achieving the goal of 'Viksit Bharat' (developed India) by 2047, several non-BJP Chief Ministers raised a plethora of demands, including a 50 per cent share in central taxes to resolving water disputes.

Iyer's heart, Ponting's vision: How Punjab Kings cracked the code in IPL 2025Punjab Kings were once a team lost in chaos and doubt. This season, they've found their groove. With a fresh strategy, strong leadership from Shreyas Iyer and Ricky Ponting, and a squad built on trust and flexibility, PBKS have transformed from perennial underachievers into genuine contenders in IPL 2025.

In Bahrain, Owaisi calls out Pak for terror: Problems emanate from there onlyDuring the interaction with the prominent figures in Bahrain, MP Asaduddin Owaisi said that the Indian government has sent them over there to tell the world about the threat India has been facing for last so many years, referring to Pakistan-based terrorism.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Did an unlikely Kalbaisakhi hit Delhi on Sunday? What's behind unseasonal stormThe rain and thunderstorms that caused havoc on Saturday-Sunday night in the entire Northwestern region, including Delhi-NCR, could be Kalbaisakhi or Nor'wester, which is a common phenomenon in western parts of India.

Very moving moment: Shashi Tharoor as he pays tributes at 9/11 memorial in USCongress MP Shashi Tharoor, who is leading a delegation to the US to articulate India's fight against terrorism, paid homage at the 9/11 memorial following his arrival in the country and called it a "very moving moment".

Caught on CCTV: Bengaluru man assaulted by delivery agent, suffers fractureThe customer alleged that the delivery executive shouted at his sister-in-law for providing wrong address and attacked him when he questioned his behaviour.

French Open 2025: Top seeds, prize money and all you need to knowFrench Open 2025: Iga Swiatek, Carlos Alcaraz, Novak Djokovic and Aryna Sabalenka are amongst the big names to be in action in the hard-court major, starting May 25.

Dissecting India's Test squad for England: New captain, bold calls and comebacksIndia have named a new-look 18-man Test squad for the England tour, led by Shubman Gill, with several bold selections and notable omissions. The squad marks a generational shift post the retirements of Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, and R Ashwin, blending youth with experience for the new World Test Championship cycle.

Russia and Ukraine swap 307 soldiers each hours after massive strike on KyivRussia and Ukraine each swapped 307 of their soldiers as part of an extended prisoner swap, just hours after Moscow launched missile strikes on the Ukrainian capital, Kyiv.

sports.headline: Credit for Shubman Gill's success goes to Yuvraj Singh and his father: Yograj SinghFormer India all-rounder Yograj Singh has credited his son Yuvraj Singh for Shubman Gill's success following his recent appointment as the captain of the Indian Test team.

Hyderabad look to end winless run against Kolkata in battle of prideIPL 2025, SRH vs KKR: Kolkata Knight Riders and Sunrisers Hyderabad will look to finish their campaign in the best possible way when they meet on Sunday at the Arun Jaitley Stadium.

Iyer's heart, Ponting's vision: How Punjab Kings cracked the code in IPL 2025Punjab Kings were once a team lost in chaos and doubt. This season, they've found their groove. With a fresh strategy, strong leadership from Shreyas Iyer and Ricky Ponting, and a squad built on trust and flexibility, PBKS have transformed from perennial underachievers into genuine contenders in IPL 2025.

Karun Nair not looking to change his game after much-awaited India returnKarun Nair said that he would not try to change his methods as he returned to the Indian team after a gap of 3,000 days. Karun is part of the India squad for the five-Test series against England.

Cricket, thank you for giving Karun Nair a second chanceKarun Nair has finally got his second chance in cricket and this time; the game deserves all the praise for the renaissance of the 33-year-old. Karun is all set for a return in the England tour.

Preity Zinta questions umpiring standards in IPL after PBKS get robbed of a sixBollywood actor and Punjab Kings (PBKS) owner Preity Zinta expressed her disappointment at the third umpire's decision as her team got robbed of a six during Match 66 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

French Open 2025, Day 1: Sabalenka, Paolini set for curtain raiserFrench Open 2025, Day 1 Order of Play: The focus will be on the likes of Aryna Sabalenka, Qinwen Zheng, Lorenzo Musetti and Jasmine Paolini when the clay-court major gets underway on Sunday.

Josh Hazlewood returns to India in big boost for RCB before playoffsIPL 2025: Fast bowler Josh Hazlewood has joined the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) before their all-important clash against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) at the Ekana Stadium in Lucknow.

Iga Swiatek chases history, but is she in good enough shape?French Open 2025: Five-time Grand Slam champion Iga Swiatek has entered a slump in her career, having not won a title for nearly a year and dropping out of the top three in the WTA rankings.

Gujarat's top-2 push meets MS Dhoni's possible IPL swansongIPL 2025, GT vs CSK preview: Gujarat Titans aim to secure a top-two finish against a struggling Chennai Super Kings. MS Dhoni is set to lead CSK for one last time-but will it really be his final IPL game?

Kush Maini becomes 1st Indian to win F2 Monaco GP, Anand Mahindra reactsKush Maini became the first Indian to win the Formula 2 Sprint Race at the Monaco Grand Prix. After he won, business tycoon Anand Mahindra praised him for the stupendous achievement.

French Open 2025, Day 1: Sabalenka, Paolini set for curtain raiserFrench Open 2025, Day 1 Order of Play: The focus will be on the likes of Aryna Sabalenka, Qinwen Zheng, Lorenzo Musetti and Jasmine Paolini when the clay-court major gets underway on Sunday.

Josh Hazlewood returns to India in big boost for RCB before playoffsIPL 2025: Fast bowler Josh Hazlewood has joined the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) before their all-important clash against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) at the Ekana Stadium in Lucknow.

Iga Swiatek chases history, but is she in good enough shape?French Open 2025: Five-time Grand Slam champion Iga Swiatek has entered a slump in her career, having not won a title for nearly a year and dropping out of the top three in the WTA rankings.

Gujarat's top-2 push meets MS Dhoni's possible IPL swansongIPL 2025, GT vs CSK preview: Gujarat Titans aim to secure a top-two finish against a struggling Chennai Super Kings. MS Dhoni is set to lead CSK for one last time-but will it really be his final IPL game?

Kush Maini becomes 1st Indian to win F2 Monaco GP, Anand Mahindra reactsKush Maini became the first Indian to win the Formula 2 Sprint Race at the Monaco Grand Prix. After he won, business tycoon Anand Mahindra praised him for the stupendous achievement.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
